html:
2 Nephi 20:33-34

The theme of these final verses is the destruction of Assyria. The metaphor of a forest being cut down is used to describe her eradication. Those of high and low stature shall all be hewn down, as boughs and trees are cut and toppled together.

33 Behold, the Lord, the Lord of hosts, shall lop the bough with terror: and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the haughty shall be humbled.

34 And he shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.		 33 Behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts shall lop the bough with terror; and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down; and the haughty shall be humbled.

34 And he shall cut down the thickets of the forests with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.
